member.name: Windows.EnumDynamicTimeZoneInformation
member.summary: Enumerates entries stored in the registry. This information is used to support time zones that experience annual boundary changes due to daylight saving time adjustments. Use the information returned by this function when calling to retrieve the specific range of years to pass to .
member.param: Index value that represents the location of a entry.
Specifies settings for a time zone and dynamic daylight saving time.

returns.para: This function returns DWORD. Possible return values include:

| Value | Description | |-------------------------|---------------------------------------------------| | ERROR_SUCCESS | The operation succeeded. | | ERROR_NO_MORE_ITEMS | No more data is available for the given index. | | ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER | A parameter is invalid. | | Any other value | The operation failed. |

member.name: Windows.FileTimeToSystemTime
member.summary: Converts a file time to system time format. System time is based on Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

param.name: lpFileTime
param.para: A pointer to a structure containing the file time to be converted to system (UTC) date and time format.
This value must be less than 0x8000000000000000. Otherwise, the function fails.

member.param: A pointer to a structure to receive the converted file time.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.GetDynamicTimeZoneInformation
member.summary: Retrieves the current time zone and dynamic daylight saving time settings. These settings control the translations between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.
member.param: A pointer to a structure.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: Daylight saving time is not used in the current time zone, because there are no transition dates.
The system is operating in the range covered by the StandardDate member of the structure.
The system is operating in the range covered by the DaylightDate member of the structure.

returns.para: If the function fails, it returns TIME_ZONE_ID_INVALID. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.GetDynamicTimeZoneInformationEffectiveYears
member.summary: Gets a range, expressed in years, for which a has valid entries. Use the returned value to identify the specific years to request when calling to retrieve time zone information for a time zone that experiences annual boundary changes due to daylight saving time adjustments.
member.param: Specifies settings for a time zone and dynamic daylight saving time.
The year that marks the beginning of the range to pass to .
The year that marks the end of the range to pass to .

listheader.description: The system cannot find the effective years.
One of the parameter values is not valid.

member.name: Windows.GetTimeZoneInformation

summary.para: Retrieves the current time zone settings. These settings control the translations between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.
To support boundaries for daylight saving time that change from year to year, use the or function.

member.param: A pointer to a structure to receive the current settings.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: Daylight saving time is not used in the current time zone, because there are no transition dates or automatic adjustment for daylight saving time is disabled.
The system is operating in the range covered by the StandardDate member of the structure.
The system is operating in the range covered by the DaylightDate member of the structure.

returns.para: If the function fails for other reasons, such as an out of memory error, it returns TIME_ZONE_ID_INVALID. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.GetTimeZoneInformationForYear
member.summary: Retrieves the time zone settings for the specified year and time zone. These settings control the translations between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.
member.param: The year for which the time zone settings are to be retrieved. The wYear parameter must be a local time value.
A pointer to a structure that specifies the time zone. To populate this parameter, call with the index of the time zone you want. If this parameter is NULL, the current time zone is used.
A pointer to a structure that receives the time zone settings.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.SetDynamicTimeZoneInformation
member.summary: Sets the current time zone and dynamic daylight saving time settings. These settings control translations from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to local time.
member.param: A pointer to a structure.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.SetTimeZoneInformation

summary.para: Sets the current time zone settings. These settings control translations from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to local time.
To support boundaries for daylight saving time that change from year to year, use the function.

member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains the new settings.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.SystemTimeToFileTime
member.summary: Converts a system time to file time format. System time is based on Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

param.name: lpSystemTime
param.para: A pointer to a structure that contains the system time to be converted from UTC to file time format.
The wDayOfWeek member of the structure is ignored.

member.param: A pointer to a structure to receive the converted system time.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.
returns.blockquote: [!NOTE] A False return value can indicate that the passed SYSTEMTIME structure represents an invalid date. Certain situations, such as the additional day added in a leap year, can result in application logic unexpectedly creating an invalid date. For more information on avoiding these issues, see leap year readiness.

member.name: Windows.SystemTimeToTzSpecificLocalTime
member.summary: Converts a time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to a specified time zone's corresponding local time.

param.name: lpTimeZoneInformation
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the time zone of interest.
If lpTimeZone is NULL, the function uses the currently active time zone.

member.param: A pointer to a structure that specifies the UTC time to be converted. The function converts this universal time to the specified time zone's corresponding local time.
A pointer to a structure that receives the local time.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero, and the function sets the members of the structure pointed to by lpLocalTime to the appropriate local time values.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.SystemTimeToTzSpecificLocalTimeEx
member.summary: Converts a time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with dynamic daylight saving time settings to a specified time zone's corresponding local time.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that specifies the time zone and dynamic daylight saving time.
A pointer to a structure that specifies the UTC time to be converted. The function converts this universal time to the specified time zone's corresponding local time.
A pointer to a structure that receives the local time.
member.returns: If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.TzSpecificLocalTimeToSystemTime
member.summary: Converts a local time to a time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

param.name: lpTimeZoneInformation
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the time zone for the time specified in lpLocalTime.
If lpTimeZoneInformation is NULL, the function uses the currently active time zone.

member.param: A pointer to a structure that specifies the local time to be converted. The function converts this time to the corresponding UTC time.
A pointer to a structure that receives the UTC time.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero, and the function sets the members of the structure pointed to by lpUniversalTime to the appropriate values.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.

member.name: Windows.TzSpecificLocalTimeToSystemTimeEx
member.summary: Converts a local time to a time with dynamic daylight saving time settings to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
member.param: A pointer to a structure that specifies the time zone and dynamic daylight saving time.
A pointer to a structure that specifies the local time to be converted. The function converts this time to the corresponding UTC time.
A pointer to a structure that receives the UTC time.
member.returns: If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call.
